div.p:
This figure highlights relationship between East Antarctic temperature and SAM at different frequency band. ( a) Comparison between the East Antarctic time record and Dätwyler SAM index
35 record. The correlation (r = 0.075) between these time series within the period 1533–1850 CE is not significant (99% significance level) whereas during the interval 1850–1991 CE, r = 0.433 is significant (99% significance level). ( b) Power spectrum analysis of Dätwyler SAM index
35 significant periodicities of 132, 22, 14, 5.4, 4.5, 3.7 and 2.3 years at 90% χ2 level. ( c) Wavelet coherence of two time series i.e. East Antarctic temperature and Dätwyler SAM records. The 5% significance level against red noise is shown as a thick contour. The thin solid line indicates cone of influence. The relative phase relationship is shown as arrows (with in-phase pointing right, anti-phase pointing left, and SAM leading SOI by 90° pointing straight down and vice versa). Scale-averaged wavelet power (average variance) over the 2–8 yr band of ( d) East Antarctic temperature, ( e) Dätwyler and Abram
34 SAM indices.
